Okay, auf den ersten Blick wirkt das Binion's Cafe ... ähm ... etwas *rustikal*. Es auch kein Café, sondern eher ein typisch amerikanisches Lokal. Es ist mitten im Casino untergebracht und wird nur mit dünnen (Papp-?)Wänden abgetrennt. Immerhin gibt es "Fenster" hinaus in Casino.
Wenn man das Lokal betritt, wird der erste Eindruck nicht besser. Es sieht alles etwas verlebt aus. 
Da wir aber Comps hatten und das Essen somit fast gratis war, haben wir uns trotzdem Burger & Fritten bestellt. Die Bedienung ist typisch amerikanisch, aber nicht typisch Las Vegas = nett, aber nicht aufdringlich. 
Das Essen kam nach einer Zeitspanne, die vermuten läßt, dass es frisch zubereitet wurde. Das hat mich ehrlich gesagt etwas überrascht, da ich wirklich geringe Erwartungen an diesen Laden hatte. Noch mehr überrascht, hat mich allerdings das Essen. Die Burger waren wirklich gut - vor allem wenn man den Preis bedenkt (5,95$) und die Fritten sehr knusprig (mit so einer Art Panade, wie Burger King sie vor einigen Jahren mal hatte). Die Burger werden hier nicht fertig zusammengebaut, einige Zutaten (Salat, Zwiebeln, Tomaten, Gurken) liegen daneben auf dem Teller, so kann man sich seinen Burger ganz nach dem eigenen Geschmack zusammenstellen. Zum Burger gehört entweder Kartoffelsalat (schmeckt tatsächlich ziemlich deutsch) oder Coleslaw (gute Qualität), die Fritten müssen extra bestellt werden (ca. 1,50$ extra).
Die Getränkepreise sind in Las Vegas generell etwas höher, hier sind sie für Las Vegas Verhältnisse etwas günstiger (Softdrink 3$, Bier 4 - 5$).
Comps werden hier grundsätzlich anstandslos akzeptiert, trotzdem empfiehlt es sich die Rechnung genau zu prüfen.
Comps (Gutscheine) bekommt man auf verschiedene Arten: 
Als Nicht-Binions-Club-Mitglied (Players-Club) z.B. über den American Casion Guide oder direkt am Casino-Eingang als Flyer in die Hand gedrückt. Um diese dann zu nutzen, muss man kostenlos Mitglied im Players Club werden. Falls man eh im Binions-Casino spielen will, lohnt sich das doppelt. Denn man kann dort täglich seine Clubkarte "swipen" und Comps abräumen (Freeplay (Slots oder Tischspiele), 2-für-1-Gutscheine, 10$- oder 15$-Gutscheine fürs Binions-Cafe oder täglich wechselnde Geschenke).
Auf dem Flyer finden sich noch weitere Gutscheine: für ein Gratis-Foto mit einer Million Dollar, gratis Spiel an Slot-Promotion-Automaten (mit der sehr geringen Chance ein paar Tausend Dollar zu gewinnen), einen Las Vegas-Kofferanhänger und 2-für-1 Drinks.
Als Binions-Club-Mitglied bekommt man Comps regelmäßig übers "swipen" seiner Clubkarte.

Ich würde hier immer wieder essen und sogar den vollen Preis bezahlen - wenn es nicht so viele Comps geben würde. Den einen Stern Abzug gibt es, weil es beim ersten Mal echt Überwindung kostet, den Laden zu betreten und dort etwas zum Essen zu bestellen.

I'll keep this one short and sweet since it doesn't deserve the full treatment based on what you get. As many of my frequent readers probably know, I recently moved my office to the downtown area which opened up an opportunity to try out a whole slew of new places. Today's review comes from a tip a regular Twitter friend sent me for a supposed hidden cheap gem at Binion's Café. Cheap it was, good it wasn't.

Binion's Café is located right in the middle of the smoky casino floor, completely open to the noise of the slots and savory Fremont St patrons. The somewhat defined space is a seat yourself, free for all of two and four top tables, as well as a small diner-style counter facing the kitchen. This is definitely not a place for ambiance or fresh smells. I went for lunch on a random weekday and it was totally packed. The 24 hour menu features appetizers, soups, salads, burgers, sandwiches and many breakfast items. There is a hangover breakfast burger on the menu that comes topped with a fried egg, 2 bacon strips, 2 slices of American cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and sweet pickle for $9.75, but that sounded like a bit much for me as I was not hung over for this meal.

Instead I went with the $4.95 Binion's Burger with some Swiss cheese. I can't even explain this burger in much detail, but will instead give you this analogy: if you put this burger in a side-by-side blind taste test with a McDonald's angus burger, it would probably lose. The generic, dry, foul tasting pre-made patty was hard to stomach, the sweaty cheese was barely melted and too salty, and the previously frozen tomatoes seemed barely ripe. The bun was fairly fresh, flaky and grilled, but too thin and did nothing to save this burger. The generic frozen fries were cooked ok, but didn't taste great and were also nothing to speak of. My $4.95 burger meal quickly escalated to $10.84 with the addition of cheese, fries and an iced tea. Going back to the McDonald's comparison, you would do better there for far less.
Terrible food, they have a steak house upstairs and ribs on the same floor but fixed us soy burgers in the cafe and they were awful.

Alright, I asked a friend that works for the MGM where in town could I get an awesome burger. He told me to go check out Binion's Cafe. So, I did and WOW! 

This is the best burger in Las Vegas. I ordered a double with cheese and all the fixings and it was awesome. I had french fries with it along with a coke. The service was decent with the waiter keeping my soda glass full. The food didn't take a long time considering the burgers are cooked to order. 

Being a local I avoid downtown/the strip like the plague but when I do go down there for now on, I have to grab one of these great burgers. Yeah, the burgers are that good!

Oh and the casino will validate your parking.

After walking around Freemont, the hubby and I needed some some fuel. We stepped into the casino and took advantage of the $2 corona special that day! We then made our way to the cafe, we figured the buffet while inexpensive and pretty sizable was just to much for us right then. Upon scanning the menu, we decided to both give the NY strip steak meal a whirl. I believe it was around 14-15 bucks. I gotta say it was a great piece of steak, the seasoning was just right and it was super tender! I was impressed indeed plus we were able to order another one of those cheap coronas in the cafe :) the service here was excellent! Our server Molly was super sweet and attentive to our dining needs! Good spot in the old strip to get a cheap delicious meal!

If you're downtown and you want a good quick classic breakfast, try Binions Cafe. We love it cause its right near a open entrance onto Fremont street. The service is fast and friendly, and the cooks know what their doing. My personal favorite is the Ham Steak, Eggs, & Hash browns, (Not hash burnts) but if you opt for this you had better be hungry, the Ham slice is humongous. You're gonna need to walk around a bit after this one !

The Hangover burger was one of the best things ever!! get a players card and you get a discount on a few items on the menu. 

Better to sit at the counter if possible because the service is much better and faster than the tables, the waiters there could be slow sometimes.. 

The chili dog was really good, a huge portion with fries for $3.75

I had them for dinner. The staff was friendly and the service was good but my 2 star rating is because my food was bland. I order a fried steak and got this patty with mushrooms and gravy with some fries. It wasn't what I expected.  The patty was just so boring and dry.  At least the gravy made it edible. The fries were good, crunchy and moist.
The price was cheap so I kind of think I got what I paid for and that's why they got 2 stars instead of just one. Also, they we're in a temporary location while the original location is under renovations so maybe that was a factor.

Food: I had the salmon, which was good.  The accompanying vegetables were overcooked frozen carrots and peas mix.  The mashed potatoes were average.
Rating: Three stars

Service: The server forgot one of our entrees despite writing down the orders.  This made the experience quite negative.
Rating: One star

Atmosphere: The atmosphere was as expected for a casual eatery.
Rating: Three stars

Location: The location downtown is good and convenient.
Rating: Four stars

Great service, super prices, and friendly, attentive wait staff.

Angela, one of the waitresses, is an absolute doll.   :-)

We will definitely be back.

This is a 4.5 star review, but the hispanic woman behind the counter was so nice to us, that I am upping it to 5 stars. We sat at the counter, and service was quick, with just the right amount of checking up with us. Definitely not the Ritz in terms of surroundings, but good grub when you are hungry at 3am, after winning your first poker tournament (sorry, I had to brag even though it was only a 20 person tournament, but I gotta live my only poker moment in history). My pastrami sandwich was very good, and I was delighted when I ordered extra cheese, and the ratio of meat to cheese was just perfect for this cheese lover. I wish they would of had fancy delicatessen mustard, but nevertheless, I enjoyed that sandwich.They served my sandwich with potato salad and sweet pickles. The sweet pickles were store bought, but I never had sw pickles with a sandwich other than tuna fish before, and I kinda liked it. I took the rest of my sandwich home and ate it for a quick bite in the morning. The price of the food was good, but it wasn't as cheap as their specials. I know one of their specials was for a chili dog meal, and can't remember the others, and I recall thinking they were pretty good deals, especially compared with the prices back home. I would definitely drop in again when on Fremont Street. PS Tip the waitress well if she does a good job for you. We saw her counting out change from the tip jar, and it was a lot of coins. I think a lot of locals come and eat here, even possible homeless people, so I bet she dosen't get the tips she deserves. 

Binion's does charge for parking, but you get the first 3 hours free with validation, or you can stay all night if you get your ticket validated if you play in their poker room. Also, I am not familiar with all the different parking options on Fremont St., but I found their parking lot convenient for access to the main strip (puts you almost directly in the middle of the action). But, one of the 4 times we had to use the small elevator to the parking garage, the elevator took about 5 minutes, the rest of the times it wasn't too long of a wait.

Do not fall for the fake BBQ

They have a new room off the cafe pretending to be a BBQ joint. It isnt. Its just the cafe serving absolute crap to the room.

The waitress here was a total joke. Indian lady who has to be pushing 60 wearing a push up bra. GROSS. But that wasn't the worst of it. She has something to say about every customer. Soon as people walked out she would turn to the bartender and talk about how annoying they were or how picky they were .... something bad to say about everyone.

She asked me how the food was and I was honest yet polite. I told her I thought the BBQ ribs were frozen with artificial smoke flavor, the sides were horrendous. Corn on the cob that must have been sitting in hot water all day. The ribs may have been smoked, I don't know, they did appear pink and the flavor wasn't that bad but tough as can be and has been sitting a loooooong time. She went to the bartender and said "these people say its frozen and after they eat everything!" I hadn't eaten half. What a jerk, I put the money down minus tip and left. Life is to short to argue or even share more polite words with such a clown. Bye Binions. I always play your tables but after this - I left your property. Perhaps you should watch this fool for 10 minutes. She has something to say about every single person while I was there. She thinks we cant hear?

I was starving that day or I would have left sooner. I chocked back what I could. Not that gymsock corn though. That was to awful. Maybe half the ribs. Not worth it all. What a sham too pretending to be a restaurant and then a runner just brings the orders from the cafe in the Casino. WEAK

went in on a Saturday night, not very busy. cooks were upbeat had a good time in the open kitchen.  we had the chicken tenders, that were not frozen they were fresh breaded tenders.  than the nice lil ribeye steak veggies and fries. very tasty and cooked perfect.

this place was great for a 3 or 4 am munchies snack meal thingy. after a long night of drinking this place was like heaven!!     

they had a hamburger special with a side for under 5 $ and it wasn't grose !! it was GOOD !!!!

deffinatly recommend this little café to anyone who needs to sober up before leaving freemont!

Walking in at 1am in morning. Server was an older gentleman and quite. Could not get a good read on him. He seated us and another server made us drinks. She was very prompt about keeping water glass full. I had turkey sandwich. Hot and good. Wife had turkey and bacon club. Nice portions. It was very busy. Older place but price was right.

LOVE LOVE LOVE the Hangover Burger and I am not a Burger person at all when I am home.  When in Vegas I must have IN & Out Burger and the Hangover Burger from Binions Cafe.  Whats better then Eggs and bacon on your burger.  YUM!  It is just perfect there.  Every trip to Vegas this place gets hit a couple times.  Once we sat at the Bar area and got to talk to once of the cooks who had been working there for over 20 yrs.  He was amazing and being a Vegas History Geek myself he had a lot of insight on the things that have changed there etc.  

I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this place no matter what you order you can not go wrong.  Make sure you get a players club card before you go so you can get a major discount on the food.

Love love love the Hangover Breakfast burger.  Greasy, cheesy, salty, delicious... I was hungover and it was EXACTLY what I needed.  With fries or hash browns (I had fries, the fiancee had hash browns, and we both were happy as clams with our food), it will cure what ails ya.   Yes, it might have weighed heavily on the gut, but the gut was churning on empty, so I was happy I didn't feel sick anymore.  The service was fine... I don't get everyone complaining about the service here.  I mean, you are going in to a casino cafe to score cheap prices with your player's card... you want white gloves and a maitre d'?  Our server was quick, if a bit abrupt.  But he was never impolite or unpleasant.  For $6.95 a meal, I will be more than happy to return.

Saw a sign for $4.95 chili dog and fries and decided to stop in late night on Freemont street. This place is no frills. Plastic table setting and a very small dining area.  Open 24hours for the late night yelpers. The burgers looked awesome but I didn't have room to try it. The place has a old diner feel with the grill right up front which I really liked.

I both love and hate this place. We come to Vegas regularly and I used to live the fried pickles and jalapeño bottle caps, enough to put aside my resentment at possibly the worst service ever. But today we stepped in, hungry as hell, to find them removed from the menu. What gives Binions? We're hungry so we decide to stay and eat anyway. The sign at the door tells you to 'seat yourself' which should tell you everything you need to know, but no, foolish as we are, we venture on in. Two menus come flying at us, and when we ask questions on the menu we just get a passing grunt. Honestly the food is ok if you are in the mood for some greasy cafe fair but seriously, the service is quite possibly the worst ever.

menu is quite weak, especially for dinner, but it gets the job done. the grilled ham and cheese was very salty, but my buddy had the club sandwich, which he said was really good. the service is quick, and the staff, in general, are positive and friendly. if staying at the four queens, you get a coupon book with a 2-for-1 meal at the binion's cafe, which would probably be the only reason for coming back.

It was late into the night or maybe early in the morning..i had to get more energy to play at the historic Binion's Poker room.
 
 i ordered  the 2 egg breakfast,nothing fancy, all I wanted was a little picker upper and that certainly hit the spot. It was good-no complaints.

I really loved our waitress; The waitress was very friendly and helpful with the menu and recommendations. She really was extra awesome when it came to blasting my toast with mounds of butter; who the hell likes dry toast? Also I got water  but I  mentioned something to my spouse about Orange juice and I guess my big mouth was over heard by the waitress and WA-LA she brought me an OJ . NOW THAT IS SERVICE

After a very long couple of nights in Vegas, we ambled into the Binion's Cafe when we saw all the signs hanging outside advertising some super cheap grub.  Well, once we get in there we realize that super cheap grub isn't as enticing as we thought  AND all the breakfast stuff was actually pretty expensive (I had no idea those prices were if you had the Binion card which I never saw posted anywhere, just read it on Yelp!)   Regardless, this place was hard on our already nauseous and fatigued bodies.  The water was sweet for some reason, the soup had the strangest looking chunks, the potato salad looked so unappetizing that my friend had to cover it with a napkin to eat her grilled cheese.  Despite the whole place just exuding an unappetizing air, my eggs and bacon were fine (hashbrowns were pretty bad though.)  Lots of toast, cheap Vegas breakfast places hook you up hardcore on the toast.   I also couldn't tell why some things were served in plastic (salad, soup) but some things on a real plate (my breakfast.)  It was almost worth eating here because we've gotten alot of laughs from discussing how grossed out we were by that meal (partially because of the place itself and partially because we were hung the fuck over.)

Our Go-To spot right around 2 AM when you need to have something solid to prevent morning hangovers. My favorite is the Philly Cheesesteak, hands down best one i've had anywhere. We also enjoy the Hangover Burger.... Binions Cafe is always on our itinerary when we are in Vegas. Service is friendly, everything is made to order so expect your food to be hot off the grill :) Mmmmmm can't wait to be back.

Really needed a late night bite. We had already hit Market St Cafe (California Hotel) a few times so we thought to stay in the neigborhood.  Disappointed by the hot beef sandwich. The bread and gravy were fine, and the QUANTITY of beef was fine, but the beef itself was tough Tough TOUGH.  I vote that they decrease the QUANTITY of beef and improve the grade; something with a bit more fat.

Was pretty hungry on Fremont St and didn't have Lipitor with me to hit up Heart Attack Grill so I stopped into here for a tuna melt.

There was a line when I got here but they cleared it quickly and I was promptly treated to a tuna melt.  It was slightly greasy aka perfect and the salad that came with it was pretty good.  All in all not a bad sub $10 meal!
The food here is awful. Made whole family feel sick. Microwaved jashbrowns frigging awful DONT GO HERE !

Typical casino cafe. I love it. Portions are large and food is good. Great place to take a break from the action. My friend had the burger because it was supposed to be the best in the area. Needless to say it did not live up to the hype. It should be titled as a good burger for the price. The tuna melt and hummus were very good.

We have been coming to binions for years and the hangover burger was great. The portion is amazing on breakfast. The service was good if a bit impersonal. My wife had the grilled cheese with red pepper tomato bisque and it was great.  We like this.

So a buddy decided to show us "OLD" Vegas on this recent trip and with nothing else going on we decided to follow. Fortunately he knew his way around and we parked in the Binion's Parking. So since we were doing it old style it is all about the saving right? 

***"Old Vegas" (OV)Hint 1*** take your parking stub with you so that you can get it stamped down in the casino for free parking.

We walked into a very old Casino and I had to stop and pay homage to the old card players in the Poker Hall of Fame. 

***OV Hint 2*** stop by the Binion's Million, a stack of bills totalling 1 Million dollars incased in plexiglass but perfect for posing for a free picture. The picture takes about 30 minutes to print up which I am sure the Casino hopes you will spend at their tables. We spent it walking around Freemont Street and then going to Binion's Cafe.

So my friend remembered having an awesome steak and eggs one time while visiting Binion's so we followed.

Well it turns out that the Cafe has moved from the old cavernous space decorated with animal heads hanging from the walls to a little cafe in middle of the casino, almost an after thought. 

It was a bit crowded so we waited a few minutes for a table to empty and grabbed it before it was bussed. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a3jFGgoWbPkPGENEafiXwg?select=lA9nWp16Lj6pHB_qoRF0mQ

***OV Hint 3***If you want to have a beer or drink with your meal in the Cafe, get it from the bar and bring it in with you. They won't say anything but you can't order a beer in the Cafe.

So we peruse the menu and no "Steak and Eggs" so my buddies decide on the Binion Burgerhttp://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a3jFGgoWbPkPGENEafiXwg?select=cCzVZ6L_J8ietdkCrIchdg a chili dog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a3jFGgoWbPkPGENEafiXwg?select=zTGBaFOCbwWRs5gK2THNIQ and I had a craving for suasage and gravy http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a3jFGgoWbPkPGENEafiXwg?select=kWyQ2e-54FlIcN8v4t0V-w

All in all the food was what you would expect for a 4.00 burger, 3.00 chili dog and 2.00 biscuits and gravy. 

Decent cheap and as fast as you can expect. 

I would say that the highlight of the dining experience was the sassy and borderline rude server. She made it feel like we were really in Old Vegas.

We chose to eat at the Binion's Cafe because we had a 2 for 1 coupon.  We were seated very quickly, given water and then sat and waited.  When I asked about placing an order I was told we needed to continue to wait for the waiter.  He eventually came over and took our order.  They seemed very unorganized and waiter was very confused.

Loved it.  First time I went down, I had a ribeye - rare and it was good.  Second time I went down, had the same thing and it was just as good.  The food is simple, the staff is outstanding and eating here does the trick.

The hobo stew and cornbread is great! Pecan pie is the most tasteless pie we've had - no good. The customer service is funny because the person that takes your food order refuses to handle your drink orders and you have to wait for someone else to come by.

Gambler's breakfast!

How do I like my burger? With egg of course!

I will give you this warning though, if you get lured in by the cheap food ads they have outside their casino, just know that those are club member prizes. No frets though, they let you sign up at the cafe. I didn't have to give my real name last time LOL

The burger here is cheap at $4.95. It comes with potato salad on the side or you can pay extra for French fries. The burger meat tasted old and yucky. The fries were good though. The price is cheap though and it's on Fremont.
This place has the best cafe,  friendliest staff, great club sign up rewards,  fun games and great atmosphere located across from Golden Nugget on Fremont Street

We were walking around & got hungry for something quick but healthy.  I ordered a cobb salad... gross!  It was all the bitter inside of the lettuce with crap thrown on top.  Eggs looked like they were hard boiled & then scrambled in a bowl.  The service was friendly though the waiters do tend to have more friendly conversations with great & not do their job more often than not. Shouldnt take 10min to cash out my ticket.

Our first visit to Binion's Cafe after several trips to Vegas, over the years.

We came here hung-over and hungry.  The 'Hangover Burger' was delicious and satisfying.  

This place is popular so the lines can get long at times. 

I'd recommend this place for:
Late night
Breakfast
Brunch

This is diner-type food (Comfort food).
Oh how I do love Old Town.  This is yet another gem - 24 hour joint with great burgers!  I think the food there tastes best at 4am, but that is just my opinion.

Went here for breakfast. I had the gambler's breakfast which consists of sausage, two strips of bacon, hash browns and eggs which I chose over easy. I also had wheat toast. It's your standard breakfast. Hash browns were a little burnt. Bacon was crisp and delicious. Sausage was good. Our meal was free with our play card. It was descent. 
The service was excellent by our waitress. Everyone was really nice. This is located inside the Binion's Casino. Our drinks were always refilled. Great service.

Small cafe which was pretty crowded. It took awhile to get our food after we  ordered - got two patty melts which were good enough- not bad but not the best I've tasted. Remember to validate your parking here before you leave.

Food decent but staff and service mediocre. They even wanted to charge for a refill on my soda! The bartender was less than helpful when ordering. Wouldn't return based on experience alone given all of the other options around. This is Vegas!!
Prime rib was awesome..our server was very nice and prompt..  Will deffently be back. Loved the vibe and the music..

Bad bad bad customer service!!!!!  Food was good...but service bad! It's even worse when you go back to talk to the waiter  call him by his name and he puts his hand in your face not once but twice and you're sitting there trying to enjoy your food with your family from out of town and the waitress is yelling at the cook demanding what she needs we ordered drinks and we're waiting for them and as we're waiting for them seeing that our party was a party of 6 a party of four came in and got their drinks before we did I would not go back to that restaurant. Everyone had attitude no smiles nothing.

Wanted a cheap place to validate my parking. Otherwise it is $2 an hour.  Well I got it!  It is on par with Dennys. Saw another person next to us eating a open faced turkey sandwich that looked good.  I ordered it and it reminds of childhood at the Woolworths counter.  It was $9 and not real great.  Husband ordered a cheeseburger.  He thought it was rather ordinary.  They have some specials on the board if you have a players club card.  Service was fair to good.  Overall it was just Okay.  Nothing so appealing to make me want to return.

The gentleman who brought our drinks was nearly impossible to understand through his mumbles and never once smiled. 

The waitress was so nasty I'm pretty sure I flinched a few times, at least once when she threw our plates on the table.  

No drink refills. Not one check back to see how things were.  Oh, and the best part?  The burn.   We ordered southwest egg rolls. They were delivered so hot, it literally burned the skin off my husband's lip. I had to go purchase burn cream, and as a fireman he is not allowed to work while burned, so an egg roll made him miss work. That's awesome.
After midnight on Fremont street ya just can't be too picky when your hungry and its got to carry ya over until morn'. It's old school and legit. Props!

Prices are good and portions are great. I almost couldn't finish all my food. I've been here for breakfast and dinner and was satisfied with both my visits! The staff was very friendly and you don't have to wait very long for your food. Will most likely return in the future.

I've eaten here plenty of times and have always ordered the Rib-Eye for $17.99... for the price, its amazing. The Chef seasoned it well, and it was good. my kids ordered the Buttermilk Pancakes and they were decent. 

this place is small, and the service is a little on the slow side, but for the prices, u get what you pay for.
Great value for what you get. Service was also very good. I would recommend at least stoping in and checking it out.
Hangover Burger and Gambler's breakfast.  Dirt cheap and tasty.  To get the discount you have to sign up and get a free Binion's gambling card.
My wife had the Binions burger and it was good. I had the Frank and Burger and it was good. Very busy aand loud for 10 pm.

Being a poker fan I'd heard about the Binions Cafe and that is was pretty good (good food reasonably priced).  A few years I read a book, Positively 5th Street (which the author enters and does well at the world series of poker) where he raves about the food at Binions.

Anyways if you are in the mood for greasy food at good prices check out the Binion's cafe.  I ordered a grill cheese with ham.  What i ended up getting was like nothing I imagined.  I received a sandwich stuff with tons of super greasy ham and cheese (tons of greese!).  Despite the fact that it probably took a couple months off my life the meal wasn't bad.  I was a bit hung over so my body actually appreciated this meal.

Binion's to me is almost a historic site.  It's somewhat painful to see them move away the world series of poker, then shut down the hotel rooms....my hope is that the casino and food establishments aren't the next to go because that would indeed be a sad sad day....

Been in here a few times per year g or the last 5 years. 

This year as usual the food was great and Angela(sorry if I got your name wrong) our server was superb.

Kind of a crowded place...i had the garlic chicken wings appetiser and the philly cheesesteak.
The bread was a little too wet and if i hadnt gone out n spent five on the slot machine right outside the entrance ide say that it took along time to come out.
I had a refill on my ice tea and got the check...23$
Not awesome but i ate enough and left
Gave them four bucks as a tip
Because the staff was pretty nice.

I was pleasantly surprised.  We needed a quick lunch before heading back to a conference and this fit the bill.  Quickly seated and serviced.  The burgers were great and drinks were promptly refilled.
Old school restaurant selling steak and eggs s day long. It was but for me but the group I was with enjoyed there meal.

Their "Famous Mac & Cheese" is well put together and VERY pleasing to the eyes for $8.00. Although I MUST admit it IS on a bit of the bland side, so if you have the available funds and time to take the upgrade of crumbled bread etc. I highly suggest so. ESPECIALLY if you favor flavor over price. It is a steal!

People stay downtown cause things the. To be a bit cheaper....it's in a casino so for the most part you would expect good quality. I'll say this...the price is right, the food is decent and the service is so-so!

I do have to say I love going downtown.  One of the best places to experience old school is binions cafe. Super simple menu, I happened to order the spicy garlic infused wings.  I was a little anxious to see how they tasted, and ti my surprise they were amazing.  I was worried the garlic would be s little over powering, but they were just right.  Our waiter James knew the small menu very well, and accommodated all of my families special requests.  Quick and to the point service, everyone was friendly and wore a smile.  Will return!
decent cup of coffee and convenient to anyone staying on freemont street

24 hour cafe inside the Binion's casino. Service is slow even when it's late and there are barely any customers there. Food is decent and what you expect given the location and price. They give you plastic utensils and then never come back once you get your food, except to give you the bill. The thing I like about the cafe being in the middle of the casino is that people in your group can still go gamble while you're waiting for your food since there are a lot of machines located right in front of the tables. If you have a players card, they have some late night specials that you can order from.

Velvety scrambled eggs (soft but not runny), bacon a bit undercooked for MY liking but still tasty, perfectly toasted marble rye & lukewarm hashbrowns. 

Awesome ladies running the place from "come on in honey, make yourself at home anywhere" to sweet serving gals. Breakfast was pleasant & service was quick, I'd definitely go back for the service, eggs & rye toast.

FOOD: 4/5
Belgian Waffle: Not Belgian, but delicious, especially with the whipped butter they provide. Easily one of the best waffles I've ever had.

Breakfast Burger: Tasty and satisfying.

Ham & Cheese Omelette: The eggs were well cooked, the ham tasted fresh, and the cheese was fine. It needed salt, though.

Hash Browns: Limp, greasy, and too garlic-y.

SERVICE: 5/5
Staff is friendly and attentive. They never let my drink fall below the halfway-full point.

ATMOSPHERE: 4/5
Interior: This cafe is in one of the most popular casinos downtown, so it's loud, of course, especially with the loudest games going just feet from your table. But it's quaint and isn't cramped. Typical diner decor.

Cleanliness: No obvious reason for complaint. All appeared to be clean.

PRICE: 5/5
Cheap -- can't be beat! And if you play some games first, there's a good chance you can get your meal comped. We play an hour or so of video blackjack each day and then never have to pay anything for food here.

FINAL NOTES
Great little diner, especially late at night. Possibly the best "fast food" option on Fremont.

Last night my hamburger was NOT good and that potato salad was just plain nasty AND my beer was NOT cold! I could have put that 20 bucks in a slot machine. I wanted bbq ribs but was told they didn't have any but as I was paying my check there were three orders under the heat lap for somebody's order. To sum it all up, l do not plan to return!

There are a few good things about this place: food is cheap, decent and when you're drunk, that's all you need! Get the Binion's burger when you're hammered since it's stable food  to settle your drunken rage. Chicken Tenders are a close runner up if you want to go low carb, not that you'd be thinking about nutrition while inebriated.  Service after hours (it is a 24 hr. cafe) becomes a "seat yourself (if you can find one)" and order/serve yourself from the counter as well. The beef stew is watery and the beef is super dry. Next time I'll try the soup...

Great little spot for food.

My wife and I were looking for a place to eat after a night of going out and gambling. We got seated immediately and got our orders taken.

I was super hungry so I ordered Hot wings and a Burger with french fries. Hot wings was good and really hot and got a good portion to go along with it 10-12 pieces. Burger was cooked really good (Medium) and good amount of french fries. Service was good and waitress was always asking us if we needed anything. Decently price ranged, I believe for my meal and wife's (Chicken fried steak) we paid around $35. Not bad. Definitely we'll be back if were ever going to grab a bite and near binions

Went for breakfast today and the food was not so good,  ordered the ham steak and eggs came with hash browns and toast,  ordered the eggs sunny side first time they were not cooked one egg completely raw as if they just broken onto the plate while the other was somewhat cooked had to have them over and still under cooked ham steak was ok toast was marble rye coffee was week. Don't see myself eating there again.

Look, it's a good, cheap place to eat breakfast when you're hungover after a night of debauchery on Freemont street. Nothing is exceptional, nor is it terrible. Like a mediocre Denny's, just a tad cheaper (especially if you are a Binion's player's club member or whatever). It worked in a pinch!
Good reasonable priced breakfast. Gravy for B&G was a little odd it was made with ham not sausage. Waitress was very sweet. In and out quick food came out hot and fast.

Blech.  Don't be fooled by all of the signs advertising a $6.95 "gamblers breakfast".  When you open the menu you will see that it is actually $8.50 unless you hold a Binions card.

Even at the lower rate it wouldn't be worth it.  Potatoes were sent back because they were too cold.  Scrambled eggs weren't very scrambled.  Bacon paper thin, sausage patti small.  

One star breakfast.  Two stars because the service was decent.

Really good chicken fried steak. 

This place goes from empty to full at a moments notice.

Service was good.

This was the worst service we have ever had at any restaurant. It seemed that all the wait staff hatred being there.  One man who was bussing tables was the only smile we saw.  The waitress didn't even acknowledge the person who was with me. She never came back to check on us.  The burger was ok though.
Breakfast is decent. Very casual dining. No thrills. Had the breakfast and the wife had a burger. All in all, the food was good for 1230 in the morning.
Service was okay. Food was okay as well. It's open during the crazy hours so it's a good stop to make when you're trying to kill that craving

Y'all. This cafe serves the BEST cheeseburger. Like, ever. I had forgotten what a good cheeseburger tasted like until I visited Binion's. Suddenly, I was 9 years old and back in my grandma's kitchen and savoring the GOOD stuff. Listen. The fries were mediocre but the cheeseburger was so damned good, I DID NOT CARE. And the older gentleman who served me? He might have been there since Old Vegas opened and I'm a testament to the fact that he's only gotten better with time. 
I'm really sad I won't taste this again for awhile. But, you can bet your bottom dollar I will be making a bee-line to Binion's as SOON as I'm back.

Being a big fan of Binion's Casino due to there very generous comp dollars on slot play and amazing treatment I visited the cafe twice for breakfast and lunch. So to give a run down this little cafe is open 24/7 and seat yourself no waiting in line just take a seat and wait for your server simple as that. 

Breakfast I went with the gamblers special.. super filling that is all i have to say between the eggs, 3 pieces of toast, bacon you name it.. basically for $9.99 it should easily keep your stomach filled up till after lunch time when you start walking Fremont and the Strip. Plus the kicker $10 meal credit on the spin the wheel promotion made it essentially free minus tip to my server which was very friendly. 

Now let's get to the serious part here! Binions famous burger.. I don't know what it was but the bun itself was SUPER GOOD! I kept asking myself damn where do they get this bun from it just compliments this burger so good. All around super good for a cheap lunch I think it was around $6.95 plus add on's put it in the $8-9 mark but super tasty the beef, and jalapenos.  Binions famous burger has it down pat I think it was easily better then most burger places in my years of trying places. My gf also found it good and kept complimenting the taste including the bun! 

Binion's cafe is a very good option at Fremont Street for cheap food and being open 24/7. I always stop back when visiting and enjoy the quick meals.

We had the grilled cheese and tuna melt! 

SO GOOD! Service was great. The sprite was fantastic

Real food, real conversation, really standard cuisine. 

This review is long overdue, about a month and a half to be exact. This was my secret spot for peaceful meals and funny conversations after each night of the Life is Beautiful festival. I also parked my car here and would get it validated after each meal, which I'm assuming they will change this for next year. The last day of the festival, parking attendants were getting wise to the real use of their spaces, and trust me it wasn't for the nickel slots. 

This place is not fancy, not pretty, but it gets the job done. From Thursday to Sunday I was parked at the cafe counter, usually around 1am, ordering everything your fitness trainer yells at you for eating: chicken fried steak, chili cheese dogs, the lumberjack breakfast, chicken fingers, and for good measure some type of fried westernized version of an egg roll. The standard color scheme of each meal usually landing somewhere between gray and brown on the spectrum. Still, I savored each bite like it was my last. Yes, this food is terrible for you, but who wants to order a salad in the wee hours of the morning? 

The service was good. I ordered food and it promptly came. This no frills style of eating can be enjoyable especially with the right company. I was usually solo when eating here so I would chat with my fellow snackers. Mostly old school gentlemen who would complained about how Vegas has lost it's "class". Apparently this dude has never witnessed the people dressed up as cardboard Transformers and bootleg Pixar characters on Las Vegas Blvd. In-all seriousness the guy has a point. 

The Binions Cafe is by no means something to rave about, but like a blue collar worker, it's reliable and gets the job done no matter the situation.

I love me some diners food and since it was on the afternoon of our return home and we where basically broke, the prices lured us in. 

I have to admit it wasn't the nicest of joints I've eaten in but the service makes up for it along with the prices. 

My boyfriend and my friend both ordered the Club Sandwiches while I was trying to nurse an upset stomach with some french onion soup.  The sandwiches looked delicious and actually was such a large portion they had to ask for too go boxes, I on the other hand basically just had the broth and crackers since it was not the french onion soup I expected, there was at least a whole onion sliced up in my bowl ( sorta looked like worms) but the broth was good. 

The breakfast special sound very appealing so maybe when I'm back in December this will be our breakfast spot on Fremont Street.
Service is above average.  Don't waste your money on a breakfast buffet, Binion's Cafe provides plenty of good food to get you going for the long day of sight-seeing and gambling.
Get a players card, get a nice discount. They serve coffee in giant styrofoam cups, so you can take them to go. Solid cafe food. The server will even sign you up for a binion's card if you need it.

Binion's Cafe rarely disappoints! Most recently, I had the fish and chips, and that included a very generous portion of high quality fish, tasty cole slaw, and french fries.  
Their burgers are also very good!
Prices are reasonable.

If I could I would give a -5 start, cheap food haven't even tasted it yet currently waiting on my server for 15 min so o can order my food Togo, why you ask? Oh because my server (CARMEN) has thee worst service soo rude seams like she hates her job, giving attitude and once again just rude, oh and the buss boy just as bad supper rude can't help with a thing because he is not a (SERVER) but yet he is touching tables as if he has some power in the back of the house.... bottom line coming from the food industry myself if I owned this place or even worked here this type of behavior would be brought up to management or frankly I would quit to just not have my name in this business. Shame on you people.
Awesome food had the chicken and ribs lots if food...watch a game or visit with friends has  full bar too...Great Service!!!

The service was good but the food was nasty. Veggies were frozen and overcooked. They looked gray. Steak was not cooked correctly and they did not even offer a new one. I would not suggest this place.

This place was very cheap and dissapointing. I wish we would've just went to Dennys.

I felt sick after eating here for breakfast.

Okay.... Disclaimer ... I only go to this place after long night of Downtown fun so the food might not be as amazing as I think it is .. but hey, If you're hungry, you want good quality greasy dinerish food at 3 am, Binion's cafe delivers. The staff is fantastic! They are pretty fast and they re-fill your water cups without even asking. Bless their hearts.

For a late night dinner, the steak sandwich was pretty good. Jaime got the chicken wings and those were really good. 

Not bad for a smaller cafe. Give them a try.
The food is OK. Their timing on their late-night menu is completely disgusting. They will tell you that they're open till 2 AM. They are not. They will literally turn you away.
This is such a great little cafe!!! Food is always good, especially the breakfasts!! And for a late night bite after having a blast on Fremont Street, the Hangover burger is a must!!!!

We saw this café while walking Fremont Street after our show at the Smith Center, and being a bit hungry we decided to drop in for a bite. Although we stood waiting to be seated as the sign stated, a waitress finally noticed us and blurted out "have a seat wherever you like". Service was friendly enough, and our server gave us several minutes to look over the menus which were already on the table. I did have to remind him about my soft drink though. So we ordered; The Frank 'N' Burger for myself, hold the bacon. And a Binion's Famous Burger for my wife. Both of our orders came with a choice of coleslaw or potato salad; odd, no fries? We both went with potato salad, unfortunately. Way too much mayonnaise and so unappealing neither of us could eat more than half. 

Rarely have I eaten a hot dog and burger combo, and the ideal seemed appealing at the time. But the Nathan's hot dog was just okay; the burger? Below average. And try eating this burger, oddly shaped with a protruding bun to accommodate the wiener. With pickles, onions, tomatoes, and lettuce, try keeping all of that together after each bite! As well as the mustard and ketchup making it a slippery meaty mess. Did I mention that the bun was probably the best part of the meal? And my wife complained that her burger was dry and almost tasteless. No wonder the abundance of salt I noticed her sprinkling it with. Ho hum, been there done that and no need to return.

Stopped here, only because we both were hungry, and had very limited options to choose from, because it was late at night, mid-week.
Anyways, I ordered a chicken fettuccine dish, which wasn't great, but wasn't that bad either! The garlic toast was great! The salad that came with the meal, was old looking, and the lettuce was warm & wilted.
 The wife ordered the Pot Roast Dinner...very poor choice on her behalf!
The roast was dry. The sliced carrot's in the pot roast looked like sliced sausage piece's..they were so old & dried out looking!! The only thing that tasted decent, was the potatoes she said. Her salad was just like mine too.
That was a wasted $33.00 dinner for the both of us, no drinks - just water - to choke it down!
Never going there again, if the opportunity presents itself!

So you've been walking up and down fremont street a couple of times getting drunk off the fat tuesday in your hand and suddenly the sign you passed at least 5 times begins to sound appealing to you "$4.95 burger and fries at Binions cafe".

I'd say the best time to go to this cafe is when you've been drinking, it's late, you're hungry, and you could give a shit about the the cigarette smell, the service, or the taste. 

Stumble in here during your "fremont experience", seat yourself, order off the sticky menu, find a filled bottle of ketchup from a nearby empty table and enjoy your meal. Who cares what it tastes like, it's food.
Counter service at Binion's Café was quick and friendly. My server, Mel from Arizona, stopped often to fill water and check on things. Try the pastrami. Great flavor and overflowed on the plate.

Classic 'greasy spoon' diner fare at reasonable prices inside the Binion's Casino on Fremont Street.  The Jalapeno Bottle Caps (fried batter dipped sliced jalapeno peppers; $5.75) were freaking AWESOME!

After having a hard time finding any sort of decent (or affordable) food late at night on the Las Vegas Strip, I was pleased to find options like the 24-hour Binion's Cafe in the Fremont Street area of downtown.  They serve just the kind of stuff you'd expect to find at a diner: burgers, sandwiches, salads, and breakfast meals.  Everything here is a pretty good value for Vegas, too: I don't think there was anything on the menu over $10.  I would totally come back here for some greasy breakfast the next time I find myself in downtown Vegas!
swell little spot for a good sanwich in old vegas

Food was decent, but the waiter (male) was an ass. Totally rude to me and my two lady friends. Never greeted us just asked what do you want. Then just dropped off the food without ever saying anything. Maybe a "is there anything else I can get you" would have been nice. Then when we needed soda refills we had to ask. The waiter then told us very rudely told us that he doesn't do refills and pointed to a lady and said she does them. What a rude place. When we complain to the lady upfront, she just said "O, sorry"  but nothing changed.

This place was very disappointing.  A couple of co-workers and I ate here after walking around Fremont and doing the zip-lining experience.  One of my co-workers said that this was one of her favorite places to eat....I'm not sure why.  

The service was not great.  Took a while to even get waters and our server acted as though she could not be bothered to even look at us to take our order.  

The food selection was not that great either.  The food was diner style.  Items like traditional breakfast, cheese burger and chicken fried steak.  I ordered the cheese burger and I am so sad that I did.  The bun was so stale and the burger was like something that had been pulled from a freezer and thrown on the griddle.  it had no seasoning at all and the cheese was very waxy looking.  The fries were cold and stale. My co-workers' food did not look that appetizing either.  

Another thing that bothered me was that it was located right in the middle of the smoky casino.  The ventilation was poor and the restaurant smelled like smoke and was not appetizing.  It did not look well kept or clean.  

So, basically...do not go here.

I've been to Binion's Cafe a few times the last week while my car is in the shop and  had the opportunity to try some of the establishments downtown. 

I'll start with the good. I was promptly seated every time I came here. It's not a very big cafe though, so if you have a party bigger than 4 people, you may have to wait, especially during peak hours. Service was very good. You actually have two servers. One will continuously fill your drinks up, and they're very good at this, which I really like. If I'm gonna pay $3 for a soda (which isn't that bad compared to most places in Vegas), I want as many refills as I can handle. Never went a minute without soda. They serve Coke products, which was also a plus. The second server will take your food order and then bring your food and your check, and that's probably the most you'll see of your second server. This isn't unique-I've been to other places that also do this, and while you get better service, you feel compelled to double your tip, which brings the price up significantly. It's a Vegas gimmick I could live without. 

Now, the not so good. The server will bring your food to you quickly, which sounds nice, but it's not as nice as it sounds. The burger is okay, but it's not very big, although you do get a good portion of toppings. The quality of the meat is questionable. It's not angus beef. It's more like McDonald's. The burger was a little undercooked more than once. My French fries have been cold and not fresh every time I went here. I'd rather wait a little longer to get fresher and warmer food. I didn't feel rushed to eat and leave quickly though by the servers. It may be a little cheaper than other places, but it comes with a cost. 

The menu is not very big. There aren't a lot of options to choose from. I'd say Binion's Cafe is more of a quick eat and go place of the basics than a full fledged restaurant. 

There are no TV's, no Keno, no music, and there isn't a lot of room. The kitchen is actually right in the cafe. It's pretty bland and there isn't any kind of entertainment. A very small cafe without a lot of elbow room, and nothing else to do but quickly eat your undercooked food and get out quickly. 

If you can get a deal or a discount, and you want something simple and quick, Binion's Cafe is fine. I ended up paying $16 for a quarter pound burger, fries, and soda after a $4 tip (again, which is split between two people), and I think you can find a better value and better food for that kind of money somewhere else. Pay the extra money and go to a restaurant and not a cafe. Not terrible, but not excellent. Average.

After waiting about 30 minutes to get in we finally got a table. Table was dirty. Waited another 30 minutes to order. While waiting on our food a cockroach ran across the table. After that, we left. Nasty!  The manager Michele R keeps trying to get my posts to Yelp and Trip Advisor removed.  I am sorry that this displease Michele but I just want everyone to beware of getting possibly sick at Binions.

Sat down, ordered, the waitress asked how I wanted my burger cooked.  Medium.  Hungry.   Excited.  Bring it on!  I wonder if she cracks up under her breath each time she asks.

The $4.95 hamburger served two minutes later tasted like it was cooked three days ago and reheated - thin, horrible, dry, tasteless, and microwaved for warmth-that thing was nasty.  Beside it laid dead soggy bread and butter pickles, a dry tomato and a airy mashed potato salad that was weird in texture & taste.  Yuck.  My friend's sad looking patty melt was adorned with a jigger sized plastic cup of cole slaw.  The place was just so dirty - everything tasted worse than old fast food - I would not return.

Suprisingly great for what it is -- a coffee shop / 24 hour cafe on Fremont.

Hangover burger is great -- it might be a heart attack on the plate, but its quite good. I also like their buns -- they're not just standard burger buns, but something much tastier.

The Belgian waffle was surprisingly good, although not really a belgian waffle -- more like a traditional american waffle.

The american cheese and ham omelette was nothing to write home about -- edible but not interesting or exceptional. It wasn't terrible by any stretch of the imagination, but its definitley not memorable.

One of my favorites for decent, good cheap food, and a great place to burn your food comps at Binions.

The Binion's coffee house restaurant (now closed) was the best ever.  There are shades of that restaurant in the cafe.  I'm addicted to the hangover burger (despite not being hung over). It's really indulgent--a fried egg on top of a cheeseburger--but heck, it's Vegas.

Racist waitress, we sat down and waited,  watched everyone around us place their orders and still no service,  just got up and left.  We were a party of 3 one black male with 2 Caucasian women.  The black waitress, totally ignored us! I'd have a 0 if I could.  Black hostess had nothing to say when we were leaving after we said we were leaving since we couldn't get any service.  Horrible!  Do not  patronize this place,  management should re-evaluate their employees.

When this was just a walk up snack bar type of place and the prices were more in line with what they should be it was fine. Now that they threw up some temporary walls and made it a "cafe" they serve the same mediocre fare at 25-70% price increases from the snack bar days. The hold overs from the snack bar menu- Hobo stew and Bean of the Day are both still tasty but not worth the wait. 
Aside from the food my hostess and server were both very poor in attitude and seemed to be miserable at work. This is another huge change from walk up snack bar days were the chef and the cashiers were frequently very jovial. 

Another situation of a casino messing with something that wasn't broken and making it lame.

This is the best breakfast spot in vegas old school home cooking . And the service is great. Our waitress remembered us from a visit before. The chicken fried steak was a real steak and the gravy home made just a great place for breakfast and the hash browns the best ever. I'm coming back again and again

Looking for something different for lunch in downtown Las Vegas. Stopped into Binion's Cafe for a burger. Ordered the Frank 'n' Burger  ( Dagwood) which is a grilled Nathan's dog and a Famous Burger Patty with cheese and bacon. Great burger, just what I was looking for. Yum!

Avoid this place! I had the double binions burger and it was probably 80% meat and 20% filler. The burger itself was way to finely ground and gross. I would rather eat a mcdonalds double cheeseburger or a whopper from burger king than eat another binions burger.

Somehow I always end up here after too many drinks and a late night of gambling. Service was decent. Shrimp cocktail was nasty.  Burger and fries, yuck! I should've went back to my hotel on the strip and paid for an overpriced meal!

GREAT BUGER and paid extra for the French Fries as I don't care for potato salad that much. Was well worth the extra...the French fries were equally as good....crunchy on outside like a coating, but wasn't a thick coating. Sat at the bar and waiter behind counter was very friendly, told me the story of he had worked there for 34years, one day they had accidentally ordered the wrong fries, everyone liked them so they kept ordering them. The hamburger was delicious, so fresh and the bread freshest ever. He also told me a local bakery delivers the buns daily and they are still warm when they get them. They were really putting out the food, saw a lot of ribs going out, will have to check them out next time....and will definitely come back for another burger. Next day before we left town I brought my friend with me and we split a burger and chicken strips which were also very good! Prices are also low and wait staff both times were very friendly. Hope they are still in business for years to come!

Looking for something different to eat we wandered into Binion's Gambling Hall and found this quaint little cafe. When we stepped into the cafe from the casino the wood floors just transport you to simpler times. The server informed us to just seat ourselves and we did just that. The waiter took our order and was very friendly. It is not technically friendly or high tech here so they still hand write the order and manually put them in. At least the order will get relayed properly the first time and the waiter made eye contact with me the whole time I was speaking. 

Wanting to have breakfast for dinner especially after drinking at Envy and the Pony Con breakfast seemed best. Eggs are the best thing when one comes down from their alcohol. I ordered the Gamblers Special with scrambled eggs. The hash browns were so good. The hash browns really take me back to those cafes that my parents used to take me too. Love the small town feel of the cafe. The prices were really good too. Also, the prices do not reflect in the quality of their food it was so delicious. 

Being wined out I ordered Coors Light with my eggs. See beer pairs well with everything. And I have such a sweet tooth today so I had to have carrot cake too. Their carrot cake is not too bad. The frosting is sweet and has no after taste. Love the feel of stepping out of the fast pace of life and into a calm if just for a bit.

Local dive inside the Binion casino. Cheap burgers and awesome fries. I really liked the burgers. They are thin and flat (similar to steak and shake). It's not fancy and the service isn't fantastic, but great to grab something f to eat without breaking the bank.
We eat here every trip to Vegas. I always get the American casino coupon book, which has a B1G1 Binnions burger. The meat is fresh not frozen, and is always amazing!

If you are looking for a good burger, this is definitely the place.  Sitting at the counter is a MUST to get the entire experience of this old school counter burger and fries.
I'l  definitely be going back!

While gambling I noticed the cafe advertisements for their hamburgers.  I thought that they looked pretty good.  So when we visited the cafe, I ordered a hamburger.  Let me first mention that I am very picky when it comes to hamburgers and very seldom order them at restaurants.  This hamburger was great.  It was not too thick and cooked on the griddle just perfectly.  It was served with sweet pickles, iceberg lettuce, tomatoes and onions.  I ordered a side of fries which was plenty for 2 people.  I enjoyed this hamburger so much that I went back the next day and ordered another one

The food here was decent. The service on the other hand was horrible. I know it's downtown Vegas and not on the strip but I expected better. Our food was mediocre and came out warm, not hot. I wouldn't recommend this place unless your starving and playing in the casino and you win a comp.

Umm it's old here ... very old ... not that good either.  The sandwich was just ok and the cole slaw meh ... nothing to rave about here ... the extra star was for the parking stamp ... good all day .. so I could walk around downtown

The place to grab cheap breakfast! Vegas is a place to spend money & being on a budget this is a great place to satisfy your hunger. Got served right away & ordered the Grid Iron Breakfast, which is pancakes, eggs, toast, hash browns & sausage/bacon... All that for $9 & the best part is they had a 2 for 1 deal.

Sometimes you're just in the mood for some cheap, greasy, & smokey diner food... that's exactly what you get at BinionsCafe.

Small open diner in the middle of the casino floor. Definitely an older crowd both patrons and servers. The food was average and don't be fooled with the adversited "low prices." They only apply if you're carry a Binion card. Nothing to write home about but everything you'd expect from to in an old Casino.
Best hamburger in downtown. You seat yourself and pay as you leave. Service is fast and professional and the price is right!

I ate here many years ago and the food, service and price were well above average. That is why I made it a must eat at again when I moved here. But, man I would be hard pressed to figure which has fallen most! I would guess the quality of the food! I doubt Mr. Binion would approve.

A nitty gritty cafe filled with drunk-loud tourists. Seat yourself. 

I come here for the bean of the day soup and hamburgers. The soup is beany-creamy and contains chunks of pork. The warm corn bread muffins and butter are a treat. For me its comfort food. The hamburger is an over 4 inch patty, though thin, juicy. Order it as you like. It comes with a light -sweet cole slaw side dish.

Good service.

Gamblers Breakfast! 

Believe it or not that sign brought me to this place...

Envision it...you are in Downtown Vegas, hungry and do not know where to go...actually I was starving.   There are all those signs hanging on the casinos on Fremont Street for meal deals...most of them you need to either be a member of their casino club or there is some huge line to get into the restaurant itself.  Oh yeah, its also 1am.  

We decided to try Binion's Cafe since it was central and there was not a wait.  It seemed like a regular little coffee shop situated in the middle of a casino.  The wait staff was veryyyy friendly...totally funny at that.  I ordered an omelette with two cheeses, sausage and bacon.  The omelette itself was overflowing with ingredients...there were a few stray onions in it which I really hate but I was able to pick them out.  It came with hashbrown potatoes which were not totally amazing but were acceptable.  It would have been a three star experience but my wife had a Belgium waffle which she proclaimed was the "best Belgium waffle she had ever eaten".  So one extra star for that amazing waffle.

If I am hungry in Downtown Vegas I would not have a problem eating here again.

Big tip:  You can park in the garage at Binion's free with validation.  Make sure when you validate you validate AT BINIONS.  We accidentally validated at one of the neighboring casinos and when we went to leave the parking garage the guy working actually noticed that it was a stamp from another casino and made us pay.  It was an honest mistake and he was kind of an ass in his approach to the situation.   Oh well.   

:0)

Went here for lunch one weekday afternoon     It's seat yourself which is fine, unless the waitress doesn't see you. We had quick service with pretty good, basic club and cheeseburger, but there were several people that left from waiting forever for their food or never being talked to. We may have got lucky with the positive experience, but it worked for us!

Newly update menu! 
This was one of he first poses I ate at when I moved here 4yrs ago. Had to try the binions world famous burger! It was alright for what it was... divey diner. Today was the first time I've been here since moving to Vegas, it's gotten a lot better! The menu has been updated, some fun new items. The Frank N Burger sounded good, but I went for the classic double with blue cheese. The side of tomato basil soup was on point!
I definitely want to come back for breakfast!

After raving about this burger time and again, my husband finally took me to get one at his favorite poker spot, Binion's. He said it was hands down the best burger he's ever had, which is a bold statement coming from him. Although he tried not to get my expectations up too high, he couldn't stop talking about it, so I had to see what the fuss was about.

The first time he went he sat at the counter and had the chance to speak with the manager who told him the same man has been forming the burgers by hand for the last 45 years, which is almost as long as McDonald's has been around. The Binion's own ranch used to supply the beef, but now it comes in from elsewhere. We lucked out by not having to wait in line, which can take as long as twenty to thirty minutes during peak times (almost anytime according to my husband, Ian). We went late Sunday afternoon and were able to walk straight up to the register to order, although the place was packed when we got there. A plain burger costs $4.95 and a cheeseburger costs $5.95, fantastic deals considering what some burgers are going for these days, like the kobe burger with fois gras that costs upwards of $70 at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar in Mandalay Place. Ian's argument for this being the best burger is that you don't need anything special to make it taste better. He likes his burgers with cheese and only cheese, which allows him to judge burgers based on just three components - meat, bun, and cheese. Binion's Burger hits on all three cylinders. You can see the meat glisten with its own juices and fat as it sits perched on a soft and yeasty bun that tastes like the dinner rolls they used to serve at Tony Roma's. The cheese just barely sweats as it clings to the burger without running off and leaving you with a translucent film of what used to be cheese. Although I like my burgers with all the fixins, I have to agree with Ian; it's a damn good burger and definitely one of the best I've had, too.

The menu is simple but not limited to burgers, and everything is made from scratch in house. I didn't see a single person that didn't have a burger in front of them, however, so I can't vouch for the rest of the menu. The burger comes with really good potato salad, but for a dollar more you can sub it out for another form of potato, french fries. Both were great so it really just depends on what you're in the mood for. I don't like to encourage Ian to go to casinos, but in this case, I'll have to make an exception.

Tip: If you're looking for a really good deal but don't feel like a burger, head to Benny's Bullpen bar where you can get a sixteen inch pizza and a pitcher of beer for $10. Valid Mon-Fri from 5PM to 1AM and 10AM to 1AM Saturday and Sunday.

We stopped here after hearing great things about the chicken! We ordered the chicken tenders, and they were delicious. Our server was very friendly, I forgot her name. Hedi I think. She was so sweet! 

But then the other waitress, Alicia... man was she VERY rude. I asked her for a straw and she was soooooo snotty. She was rude to the other customers as well, and they were complaining. I did tell the lady at the front how very rude Alicia was, but she didnt seem to care. Alicia is the reason for a 2 star instead of a 5 star, unfortunately. So if you get lucky and dont get her as a server, I am betting you will have a great experience!
Join the club and get 2 for one entrees during your birth month and special members only prices!

Well they finally got their act together.  Use to be really good then they remolded and the quality took a dump, but its back!  Yes I put this place back at 5 stars, now honestly since the change I havent tried everything on the menu, but I can speak to the Philly Steak Sandwich, the Binion Burger and the soup and they all came roaring back to 5 star.  Portions are very healthy and the hot sandwiches or burger are served with a side of potato salad or fries.  Im a big fan of the potato salad, they put a homemade touch to it which make it very taste.  Both the Philly steak or the burger taste like they are back to using fresh meat.  If you are in downtown, looking for a quick bite for under 10 bucks you should give Binions Cafe a try.

I went here late night for the "famous" burger.  It was very mediocre.  They put one sad looking piece of cheese on it that the chef did not even bother to melt.  The bun was good and the best part of the burger.  Also I was ticked off that there were players card specials that they do not tell you about and are not on the menu.  They are hidden at the host station. I said "I wish the waitress told me about the specials" and she says "Oh you need to ask"  How can I ask about something that I didn't know existed?

Mmmm place is all right i guess...
You walk in and seat yourself...
Theres a waiter ughh his name is WILLIAM,
HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!
His way of taking our order was so disrespectful ...
Food tastes good but kinda greasy...
I had the alfredo shimp pasta!
Above all is an ok place...
The cashier was nice though...
My friend ask her "no mints after paying" 
She said sorry no money for candy and as we were leaving she said "hey wait"
Took some gum out of her purse and give us some

This business listing might as well be called Binion's Cafe-The Third Incarnation on account of the fact that this is the third location of the Binions Cafe. Before this one opened up in the Winter of 2014, there was a self serve Binion's Cafe where you would order at the counter then bring the food to your table. Going back even further there was a full service Binion's Cafe down the stairs in the northeast corner of the casino. This was the Binion's Cafe that I grew to love and that the new Binion's Cafe couldn't hold a candle to. This was in the days when the majority of the casino cafes offered a vast menu with reasonably priced delicious food served all hours of the day. The limited menu at today's Binion's Cafe is a skeleton of the original location's. Gone are the Chinese food specials, prime rib specials, and a few more menu pages of food. And with all this said, when I recently dined in the new Binion's Cafe it was an ordinary experience with memories of extraordinary dining experiences in the first location. 

    Time flies by so fast that it feels like yesterday that I gave a tip that Binion's Casino (the hotel is presently dark) is going through a refurbishment. The refurbishment included the relocation of Binion's Cafe in early 2014. Blending in with the casino, the cafe was designed with brick walls interspersed with pictures of old Las Vegas and video menus. It was on a recent Saturday night chilling out on Fremont Street that I stepped behind these brick walls for dinner. 

    I can't complain or compliment the hostess owing to the fact that there was none. The sign said "seat yourself,"  and the two in my party did just that. Two would be the number of the night. The menu was two pages. And there were two issues with phone service being that this is a Verizon dead spot and there was no WiFi. 

   Within a few minutes of seating ourselves, our server Jerry introduced himself and from that point forward the poor man provided decent service. I say poor man because the table of drunk people that sat themselves in back of us were harassing him. That brings up the point that when dining off the Fremont Street Experience it is a strong possibility that the restaurant your dining in could suddenly take on the environment of a Junior High school cafeteria. 

   When I perused the menu, I was thinking to myself that this is not Old School Las Vegas. On the night that I visited there were zero signs of a prime rib special, steak and shrimp special, or any value. As a matter of fact the five entrees that I saw required an additional $1.99 for a soup or salad. There were zero entrees that caught my eye. I resorted to the World Famous Binion's Burger. 

   The World Famous Binion's Burger started off at $5.95. The deal is that it came with potato chips or potato salad. Personally I like French fries with my burger. Substituting fries added an additional $1.49. The deal is that I also like cheese on my burger. That was an additional $1.25. Bottomless Coke was not included. The Binion's website alleges that every burger is made daily at Binion's Butcher Shop (Where!?), never frozen and prepared to order. I allege that the World Famous Binion's Burger was solid yet nothing exceptional. Just like the cafe that serves it. 

  After paying the bill and walking towards the neon lights of Fremont Street, I left with some thoughts on Binion's Cafe. I think that the new Binion's Cafe is a shadow of its former self. Most importantly I think that their menu needs to be expanded with more entrees and specials. What is a Las Vegas casino cafe without a prime rib special? It wouldn't be a bad idea to hire a hostess to greet the guests. Isn't this Las Vegas? My ultimate thought is that there are zero redeeming qualities that would lead me to go out of my way to eat in the third incarnation of the Binion's Cafe.
Café is a madhouse, Go to the bar in back same food, I can only speak on the ribs and the prices are great, bbq chicken not so good.

Wandered in here after passing numerous signs advertising a chili dog and fries for $3.95. It's free for all seating, and we had to flag down a waitress to get menus. The food wasn't fantastic, but it was good. I had the chicken strip plate and was impressed at how juicy they were for diner food. Overall? A good spot for late night/early morning hunger! You can't beat the price.

In days of yore, a trip wasn't complete without a visit to Binion's for the bean soup, but much gas has been passed since our last visit. We each ordered a bowl of this day's black-eyed bean and ham soup that was accompanied by a generous portion of corn bread. The soup was under seasoned and the corn bread was dry due to over baking, so much for nostalgia.

When I'm in Vegas I can't resist the urge to sit at the counter at Binion's.  It's old Las Vegas at it's best.

A little dirty-yes, seedy even-yes, amazing-hell yes. 

A cheap burger, an old school counter, it doesn't get better. The people are always friendly (Especially Michelle behind the counter) and the regulars (Chin and Louis I'm loooking at you) are quick to make conversation. You must sit at the counter, after one visit you'll already be feeling like a regular.

Beware! Prices are low, you're suppose to get what you pay for! Not here. Absolutely horrible. Funny thing, as we were getting ready to leave, a group sat next to us and one was claiming the best burger in the world. What world? I had the double burger with cheese. Mealy, mealy, mealy! This meat, I think, was ground at least 2 times until it was so fine that the mouth feel was like eating sawdust. I'm not exaggerating. If this is the last place on this world to eat at, I would suggest finding the world the group next to us were from!

Came here Last weekend on Friday lunchtime, My husband was very very hungover & was not in any kind of way being patient. We walked thru the Casino saw No wait here. You do not have to wait to be seated at this 24hr diner in the heart of the Casino. We both immediately sat ourselves & was greeted with a nice smile by Angie the waitress, she took one look @ my husbands face & says the Hangover Burger is what he needs. We took her advice it was made in a Jiffy by the two cooks that you can see them waiting for Angie to put the order in. Soon after had a really nice hot cup of coffee. I was really impressed by how good the coffee was. By looking at this place you would not think it is anything special. But trust my review, I am coming from experience of being a waitress of 13 years with IHOP Corp. Fresh ingredients, made fresh off a Hot grill & a hot steamy cup of GOOD coffee that they always came by to refill gets my VOTE every time. The Hangover burger also to my surprise had a fried egg on top, which can you tell I did not read the menu. LOL, How did they even know I like my egg fried Over hard? I have no clue, all I can say is I gave her a $20 dollar tip to Angie, who I can hear her waiting on other customers coming from all walks of life & she treated everyone  like they were family.  After she even made me a cup of coffee to go back to our room,(even though we were staying at the Grand Hotel) We left after that & my husband says "You know what, I feel much better after that meal".
Yup, Angie was right honey, as I replied. We live in L. A. County & I just cannot wait when we end up in Downtown Vegas again to swing by the cafe & have another Hangover burger & hopefully catch Angie on her shift.

This place is on Fremont street experience. You can walk in and seat yourself which is kind of nice, it was 2am when we did it. Our server was there with in seconds took our order and brought our drinks out immediately. It is kind of noisy since it is inside the casino. 
The food was nothing to write home about but was not bad. They do give a good serving of food though. It will fill you up. We ordered the club an it was a large sandwich and came with fries. It could be shared by two people if you are not that hungry.

At the end of a long travel day, this was perfect.  Fine dinners are planned for other nights, but the Hangover Burger and the country fried steak were great!  We're from Tennessee and this was good country cooking and it was CHEAP!  Service was good.  Ambiance was what you'd expect at a cheap place downtown...good people watching through the windows.  Think Waffle House but WAY better for the same money!

Maybe if I'd paid $4.25 for breakfast at 2am here I'd write a better review, but, over $30 for two people for the absolute most crappy breakfast I've ever had in town was way too much.   I'm just hoping the scrambled eggs came from an actual chicken.

This place looks like how I imagined all Vegas cafes to look. My bf and I both ordered the binions cheeseburger. I didnt let myself order the bacon.. trying to cut back. 
I ate my burger sans 1 bun - and it was really good. It had good flavor but the pickles they use are sweet... not my kinda of deal. Served open face. 
They are very big on RED ONION here. 
SIDES: My cheeseburger came with potato salad.. sounded like a good idea @ the time.. I asked if it had onion to which she quickly said no. 
it had MORE ONION THAN POTATO. ah well calories saved I always say. 

2 burgers with water $13.00 - not bad considering most places on the strip charge $13 for a single burger.. .much less 2. 

Would I eat here again, yes but I'd get the $6.00 cobb salad nxt time. :)
