They also have several specials for card holders, neither my bf or I are b/c we NEVER win @ Binions so we never go there. . ok we go there hoping to win and we dont. .

Seat yourself.  Cramped space. Crusty old waiters trudging around. Fat customers gobbling. No smile waitress takes the order.  And the 100% all beef Nathan's hot dog with real chili and shredded cheddar with creamy red potato salad with a sweet dill pickle.  Oh man.  Forget the atmosphere, and eat that dog with real beans and mix it up with potato salad drizzled with onions and washed down with an ice cold Coke.  Nice place to stumble into.

So you are downtown with a grumbly tummy and have been a little over indulgent with the late night night partying and scarfing multiple questionable food items.  You are craving something simple and satisfying.  Welcome to the Cafe.  The menu covers your simple cravings from breakfast to dinner.  My personal favorite is the Binion Burger.  Nicely toasted puffy bun with a well grilled burger patty.  All the toppings are served on the side to allow you build your own personal favorite.  If you want extra anything, just let your waitress know.  The staff here is more than accommodating. This is a nice place to kick back, slow down and enjoy a nice meal.

Went to the counter here at the cafe for the first time in years and realized how it was missed.  The wait staff were energetic, pleasant and actually seemed to be happy to be there.

It's a greasy spoon diner - had the burger and it was excellent - with a ton of fries for $5.  Deal.  It's been there at Binions for 2,000 years - give it a try - you'll have a good time!

Had the Hangover Burger. Came with an egg, bacon and fries. So delicious. Hit the spot after craving a burger. Service was quick, refills came timely. Inexpensive with a players card. A huge burger and fries for $6.95. Can't beat that deal. Will be back for sure!

I am APPALLED at the service I received here! On may 9th, 2017 I came here with a party of 15 for a mini celebratory graduation dinner and I could tell from the start the server wasn't happy to see us. His name was GILMORE and he was hovering over my side of the table, being rude and giving us rude looks while we had ordered waters for the table. When he had come back and set all the waters down, I politely asked if I could also order a Coke, to which he replied "yeah you're gonna have to wait a bit". When he brought my drink over he stood around the table pretending to be busy as if he was waiting for me to take a sip. WHO KNOWS WHAT THEY LET THEIR WORKERS GET AWAY WITH.

It's about 2pm, and we (We being my Girlfriend, a friend of hers and myself) were hanging around Freemont when we got hungry as none of us had breakfast.  Our Vegas weekend was on it's final leg which means most of our $$$ was practically gone and the prices here seemed to fit our budget just right.

Being as we were all hungry for breakfast the Hangover Burger looked very appetizing and I almost ordered the Gambler's Breakfast but there is something about Club Sandwich that made me order otherwise.  

The cafe seemed a bit small but the Service was good and made up for it.  Our waitress was really friendly and the prices for the food were very reasonable (even if you are not a Club member). I look forward to coming back and trying out the Hangover Breakfast Burger!

.

Ok so it was late and we were hungry. Signed up for the Binions casino card to get a discount on food. The draw was the hangover breakfast burger. I skipped it and went for the chicken fried steak and eggs. My daughter had the hangover burger, and the wife had a regular cheese burger. My chicken fried steak was 6.95 with my card and let me tell you it was a real hand breaded chicken fried steak! I saw the cook making it. It was real beef and came with a pretty decent home made cream gravy. Top that off with some fresh fried eggs cooked right and some real hash browns and you got a meal(or a heart attack). The Hangover burger was a burger with topped with a fried egg, 2 slices of bacon and 2 slices of cheese. It came with fries. My daughter said it was great but a too much to finish. The regular cheese burger my wife had was fresh and juicy with a nice melted american cheese on it. It came with a potato salad she said was very good. Service?  Not much to speak of but hey it is cheap killer (literally) food. I was very surprised at the quality. Much more home made than expected.

Last night was a nightmare! The staff was rude and unprofessional! We didn't get served or spoken to for ten minutes. The waitress just threw our straws for the water on the table and didn't ask if we were ready to order. We got up and walked right out because of their terrible service. Never going back to that place!

Block rockin' classic burgers, the beef is ground fresh on site and you can tell. Fries with the skin on, and refills coming at rapid fire pace made this 24 hour spot a hit. Also had a bite of the chili part of a chile cheese dog with some fries, made for some crispy gooey goodness. I would have no problem ordering the chili on it's own and maybe spiking it up with some hot sauce. I don't know if they offer chili cheese fries on the menu, if they don't, they should-yeah that good. Back to the burger...it's a whopping 1/2 pound of ground there- ground beef. Not only does that insure a fresh flavor, it also insures that you are not being fed "pink slime" (google it-nasty stuff) like most other burger places. Burger is served on a nice sturdy and moist bun with all the classic toppings.  Binion's Cafe makes all food that is terrible for you.... oh so downtown delish.

I haven't stopped talking about this place since I went last week.  I walked into this place with no idea what to expect and a bogo coupon in hand. It's a typical diner style place- plopped in the  middle of a saggy casino.  It smells of smoke- the serve drinks in styrofoam cups- the menus are slapped down in front of you. It has all the ingredients to make you want to run out- but it's WONDERFUL.  We sat at the counter- received overly zealous service and were fed quickly. The Burgers?? Well in  one word- PERFECT! Freshly ground beef (never frozen) crisp lettuce, tomato onion and pickle on the side. Perfectly toasted bun and french fries.  We got some mayo packets on the side and were in HEAVEN. I have literally been thinking about the best BURGER I have ever had since I left. I should have eaten it a couple more times before I left.  These aren't the modern fancy pants burgers you can get now a days at so many 'Burger Joints'- this is the classic- thin patty- great meat- fresh veggies and buttered bun. Our bill with the BOGO and drinks and fries (that's a buck extra) came to $11- we left a $20 and made the servers day- She was fantastic!
The service was slow that our waiter celebrated his 91st bday and got promoted all in the time we had our mediocre burger. I deserve it though, I was too lazy to eat anywhere else.

Come on folks! Every time try to get one of the advertised treats, the line is long. If you always have long lines, it's time to get more cash registers and employees unless your intent is to get customers standing in line to just get them in the casino so you can "look" busy.  Can't comment on the food because never taken the time to wait in line for it. I come to Vegas at least once a year since 1992 and not willing to wait in long lines for every day food.

Excellent breakfast food.  We decided to stop in after our first time in the downtown Vegas area.   The country fried steak breakfast wife had was delicious.
I had the hangover breakfast. Which was this delicious burger topped with a fried egg and fries. 
All delicious and worth every penny.  Get the players card for a good discount and you won't regret it.   Will stop by again at first oppurtunity
The food was average, but overpriced. The service was sluggish and employees were disorganized as if they were working for the first time.

It's extremely small and tucked away in an old casino, but you really can't go to Vegas without partying on Fremont St. all night and then getting the country fried steak at Binions Cafe when you're drunk as hell.

We are staying at the Golden Nugget this place is in the casino across the street.
I had gone to the gym and didn't want a buffet , 
There was a line no host or host was busy ? Finally get in, old school greasy spoon type restaurant ,   I'm cool with that.
Super hungry I order the New  York  steak and eggs $ 14.99  that's reasonable right. Food arrives this was the smallest New York steak I've ever seen!!  2" by 3. 1/2 inchs and 1/2inch thick maybe! Smhh! The eggs runny and under cooked scary!  Asked for medium got well done . The hash browns White barely cooked .  Got the distinct feeling the cook was extremely rushed ! Really hard to get breakfast wrong, but they did it !  I'll go to IHOP next time!!

My husband and I went here on a whim for dinner one night because there was no wait and it's diner-like atmosphere struck out fancy at the time. 

The food was decent, but nothing to get too excited over. I had the chili Mac soup and a salad and my husband had the chicken finger basket. It was all good and satisfied our hunger. 

The downfall for us was the service. Our server just wasn't very attentive. And after we got our food, he pretty much just never came back to the table. We had to flag him down to get our check. Thankfully we weren't in a hurry to get anywhere. 

If you're looking for a casual meal with no frills and a very laid back atmosphere, this place could be for you.

Well, I usually knock off a star for bad service which is what we've been getting a couple of times we were here but the last visit which was yesterday for lunch was different, we got a really nice server.
Now regarding the food, we never got bad food from here, so far we tried the hangover burger, Frank burger ( I think that's what it's called ? ) and the club sandwich, my daughter really love her club sandwich, oh the potato salad is really good too.
The wait for the food can be a little long if they are busy.

Came in and its seat yourself. Entire area had empty seats but we were told we could not sit there. Employee was an asshole. They made everyone who came in wait at the door, despite there being 50% of the tables open. Friggin rediculous. How can a restaurant with customers coming in wanting to spend $ treat its customers like this. Myself and the people who came in after us walked out. Plenty of places to eat downtown. Employees seemed like they didnt even want to work. 

It used to be a dive lunch counter and was cheap. Now they tried to make it look like a trendy cafe and took the counter away. And the proces are outrageous!

Welcome surprise we just wanted alittle something before bed after along day. This is nothing fancy but the food was great and hot the. Staff very friendly. The best thing we tried was they have a chicken breast that is like a side dish and it was so darn dood our table ordered another one since we were all sharing appetizers oh my it has such a great flavor and so tender I do believe it was some of the best chicken I have ever eaten you gotta go try it. The next morning I got up early and went right back and for breakfast what did I get another darn chicken breast with hash browns and coffee the hash browns were not that great but the coffe was good and the chicken was just as good as the night before and the price was good

It's cheap (compared to other casinos), pretty fast and the food is OK.  This place is a greasy spoon diner place in the middle of Binions casino.  Both times we ate here it was very busy, but they move people through very quickly.  No one stands around, everyone is constantly moving and getting things done.  With that said, the staff is friendly and won't rush you if you want to finish your cup of coffee.

I went there for lunch and ordered the pulled pork sandwich when I got the sandwich it was more like chunky pork and it was dry I don't know what they're doing to this cafe but they are ruining it everything on the menu has changed in the preparation and in the taste I would not recommend Binions cafe

After walking for hours it was time for coffee we happened to be in Binion's Casino on Fremont Street,a bit of a Time warp when you observe the decor, and the people...stopped into their cafe' and ordered coffee only  it was served fresh, Hot, and delicious followed up by another cup as soon as you put down an empty mug which was probably held by a dusty ole Cowboy at onetime. Surprisingly pleasant experience and a very good cup of Coffee

Just what we needed at 1am! Steak, eggs and hash browns were so good! Comparable to a Denny's I guess.
Service was so so. I'm sure they were tired and wanted to go home. They are probably also tired of dealing with drunk people at that time of night. Nonetheless.... Great food for great price!

Breakfast ok nothing special -very noisy -tried to eat dinner there -hostess refused to seat us at table just inside the entrance because she said one of the servers left -I asked if she would rather lose a customer and she said yes -so we left ate excellent meal at golden nugget

You cannot go wrong if you play at Binion's.  Spin the wheel, more than likely, you'll get a 2 for 1 offer or $10 off your cafe order.  The food is okay, nothing to write home about, the country fried streak is great.  We get it all the time when we are there.

Service is hit or miss, on par with the rest of the reviews on here.  You get what you pay for!!  They serve Coke products here :/  Otherwise, the potato salad is also really good here.

Came to the bar and ordered a "likiliki" drink - super fruity cocktail in one of those big long cups! 

We are in Vegas, minus well enjoy it and party like a rockstar! Party like a rockstar! ;)

Won a 2-4-1 burger at the cafe with my players card.

I don't know why the waiter asked us how we wanted this cooked, because these burgers are just plastic meat they throw in a bun.

Seriously, my kids have play food that probably taste better than this stuff.

Giving it 2 stars because of the staff.
They were very nice and attentive. 

Cool in the back had a beard cover too.
That's was impressive. 

Food - not even close to impressive.

Binion's Cade was very racisttttttttttt. I was there for first time and everything was ok but the second night when we came back as soon as the sever find out we are from Iran ask security to inform us that they can not serve us without any reason. I am so sorry for the management

.
 back

Alright so this place has some great deals, which always makes my wallet very happy. I came here with a large group and we got sat right away. Our order took only a few minutes to arrive and that is really positive because all of us where starving. This was a great place inside a very old school casino so I felt like we had done it big in Vegas and we were at our last couple bucks. I knew this wasn't the case but after all the clubbing and drinks I could use some affordable eats. I was told to sign up for the players club and I received a two for one coupon that really helped. We then ordered the hangover breakfast which was a delicious breakfast burger with a side of hash browns. Along with my two for one deal I went with the country fried steak and that was also bomb. The steak was crunchy with the right amount of gravy and both my wife and I were left stuffed. I truly suggest this place because the portions were huge and the prices were not and that means a lot in this city.

This was very reasonable price wise. We got two Philly Cheese Steaks that were loaded with cheese. This was one of the more low end things I have eaten. While it had good flavors it looked like they skimped out by getting lower quality meat and defiantly could have loaded it up with more veggies and onions. The service here is very good, all the waitresses are very friendly and happy to help you.
Service was friendly (8/10).  Quality was above average (7/10) and price was great (8/10).  If I stay around there and need a quick breakfast or late night, I will go for it again.

It sucks because I loved this place and with improving it seems it has went downhill. Prices went up, food quality is downhill some and the diner vibes arent what they are along with closing around 1 now. Would still go back but a bit of a let down. Get the potato salad...it is darn good here! Service here is insanely quick and amazing. They are on top of drinks and anything you need...some of the best Ive ever had honestly! Food is out super fast!

Great place to grab a bite while in Downtown Las Vegas. Make sure to sign up for the Slot card to save some $. 

They offer $3.75 w/card chili cheese dog with fries.

$4.95 Hamburger with either potato salad or coleslaw. Extra charge to upgrade to fries and add cheese.

Grate place to grab breakfast, lunch and dinner and won't break the bank.

Service is fast friendly and efficient. 

Sit yourself and grab a menu type.

Use your comp points for free food.

After walking through Fremont Street we got a little hungry, so this was the closest place to eat so there we were. The place was a little busy so the wait was a little bit long, but let's get to the meat of the review. To keep it light, I decided to go with the chef salad. Let's just say, the presentation was something you would see in Home Economics. It was basically a plate with strips of 3 different meats and sliced cheese, like Kraft cheese. So I was a little hungry so I shrugged my arms and start to eat. My fork gravitated towards the roast beef so I take a bite and I swear I must have eaten 5 day old, in 120 degree, road kill. The taste and smell was so rancid that I asked the server to take it back, take it off my check, and to not replace it with anything else. So sad because Binion's is my go to place for inexpensive steak and eggs. The only think great about our visit was our nice server. Other than that I won't be back..

This place looks nice when you look at it but when you order food the burgers were soy burgers or at least they taste like it, it's like your basic diner food, not very good class and probably won't returning it's sad because Binion's is suppose to have good food. Sorry I had to give it two stars...

OMG! I mean OMG! If you're craving for food in downtown Vegas. I would suggest you to go to the 4 Queens. The food is a kinda Deli-style which isn't the best.

Atmosphere 3/5: The atmosphere is a deli-style Cafe. Nothing over the top, I mean you're at the Binion's Hotel. Com'on!
Food 1/5: Ok here's the deal. I ordered the Cheeseburger which was alright. I mean you're talking about Frozen meat, fries and most likely salad and tomatoes. So it cannot be that tasty and delicious but I mean it will hit the spot. Now I ordered a Ceasars Salad ($5 ish the salad) and I laughed when the waiteress brought me a plastic container the Salad, Bread crumbs and Cheese on a smaller dip container and some ceasars salad dressing to-go style. Literally, I could have bought the same Ceasars Salad package at Costco it would have been the same?! WTF! So I was more surprised then pissed but if you decide to go there, stay away from the salad.
Service 3/5: The waiteress was really nice with us. Deli style of course but nice.

I will not eat again at this place. It's just not the kind of place I want to spend my money in food. But it was great tho to try out.

Tip of the Day: If you want to park in Downtown Vegas, park at the Binion's Self Park and validate your parking ticket next to the Cashier for a free 3hrs Parking.

I would have to say the food is not bad here but I totally agree with some of the negative reviews on service. It has to be one of the worst places to go later at night. 

I remember going and It looked like no one even worked there, There was four of us we went to Fremont Street and walked around after hanging at Binions for awhile. So we decided to eat here before going back to the car.

A lady came out and said it would be a little bit but she only had one other table,
We sat for 30 minutes and she never came back to our table!!
Finally we all decided it was not worth sitting here any longer and we walked out, 

I am sure that's what she was hoping for..

If you can get into this place it is not too bad if you can get better service and not have to wait too long.
We have been here times before and it was not bad at all and actually had a pleasant server.

The hotel is old and so is the dining area, Nothing fancy, just a place to grab a cheaper meal,

25 minutes before the waitress would come to take our order.  While we waited four tables of customers walked out.  Chicken was dry, prime rib was good, pizza was ok.  Don't sit in the back of the restaurant if you want decent service. Not going back there EVER.
The honey mustard was served to me looking like cold turkey gravy. And the hummus they have looked like dried mash potatoes. But the breakfast my brother had was good he stated

Alright so we were downtown Fremont enjoying a fun date night out and happened to smell the burgers a sizzling over at Binion's cafe. We were hungry and  remembered the yummy burger we had last time. Our service and experience from the previous visit was horrendous and we decided to give the Cafe another shot! We decided to stroll through and check out the wait and to our surprise there was no line and plenty of open seats.

We grabbed a seat at the bar and were greeted by the main cook who is Awesome! He took really good care of us all of the way through, kept our drinks filled and even chatted with us for a bit.

The burgers were delicious and our tab was low so you can't beat that with a stick!

I am pleased to announce our visit was much better this time around so we will be back for burgers!
The food here is surprisingly delicious! the burgers and cheese steaks are great! its really cheap too! i will definitely be back the next time im in the area.

This little cafe presented me with my finest culinary surprise during my trip to Vegas

It doesn't look like much and nothing on the menu really sticks out. I ordered a hot pastrami on rye expecting it to be small and dry. It was huge and mouthwatering. They must cook it in-house because I've NEVER had a better pastrami sandwich. I may have had one as good, but never a better one. The sandwich really made my night

AWFUL! This place needs to be shut down by the health department. We waited almost an hour for our meals and they only showed up when we got up to walk out. Plastic plates, plastic silverware and styrofoam cups, WTF!?!? Our food was COLD, no wonder.. If it had been under a heat lamp the plastic plate would have melted! Watched a server try to re-heat fries in a metal bucket under a non-warm heat lamp then serve them.  This place needs to be shut down.

What a change! I used to eat here quite often when the poker room was doing their promos back in 2010. Anti-social behavior and bad social skills is just something you expect in Las Vegas, but I still get irritated by it. The staff here had typical vegas-style awful service back then but times have changed. 
 
When I came here yesterday, I noticed that they had restaffed the whole place. Back in 2010, you had to wait awkwardly at the counter for like 10 minutes before some really messed up looking woman would incoherently whisper at you "uuuhhh I be a coming you with you soon to order take you".  This time it was far better. The woman who took my order was very friendly, took my order promptly, made me feel like Binion's appreciated my business, and she could actually articulate a full sentence!

The food was also very good. I got the Philly Cheesesteak. It was the best Philly I have ever had outside of Philly. My friend got the Burger and he enjoyed it as well. The coffee was also very mild, which I like. I get really sick of how places try to make the coffee too strong by burning it. The coffee at Binions was exactly what I wanted.

 I gotta say that "Binion's Cafe" is the best 24 hour food in all of downtown. Golden Nugget has a good 24hour restaurant but they charge like $15 just for 2 eggs and toast. In terms of value and food quality, I think Binions is far better. It's most definitely better than that "Lanai Express" where they try to trick you by selling you dog food and labeling it as "orange chicken". 

The things I like the best about Binion's is how efficient the staff is. Most casinos, even places like the Wynn and Red Rock have staff that don't know how to run the comp card in the system. Here at Binions, you hand them your comp card and they charge you the right amount instantly and you are done. Much more efficiency then other casinos.
Always a must stop place whenever Im in town... Great food , super friendly staff and AWESOME prices... 3 of us ate for less then 20 bucks !!! Now that is a real Vegas deal!!! ILL BE BACK BABY!!!

Aug. 28, we came in to have lunch, we sat down very quickly. I had the Hangover breakfast burger with fries, my brother had the Philly cheese steak sandwich, my husband had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw . The food was great and service good. The prices were also good. 
 They only thing I didn't like is that the waiter would stand over us I felt like he was rushing us.
burger was okay, french fries were salty.  good for the price.  and not too bad for Fremont street.

Average food, decent price, good service. Was looking for a really tasty meal without spending an arm and a leg and the place seemed packed so thought it was a good sign. Plus we were tired of working around looking for a spot. Two of us ordered Philly cheesesteaks which were good but we felt too full and heavy afterwards. We ordered fries instead or potato salad and those were perfect to my liking.

Con: husband ordered steak sandwich and it was missing a lot of flavor and was a slab of steak on bread. Not even cut up or anything. He had to add salt pepper A1 sauce and ketchup to give it life.

Perfect place for a truly classic breakfast. We've eaten here twice on this Vegas trip, but plan on at least one more breakfast at Binion's Cafe. I got the Binion's special both days, and for Vegas, I'd consider it pretty cheap. Husband had the Benny's special and the chicken fried steak and eggs. All were exactly what we were looking for. If you want classic diner breakfast that transports you to small town Wisconsin/Minnesota diners, come here. Eat. Be happy.
